It is important to note that such comparisons are less straight forward as the link between long
temperature goals and these indicators is less pronounced compared to the e
they are therefore associated with greater uncertainty compared to the emissions gap.
NDCs have been an important driver of national adaptation planning, with cascading effects on sectors
national action, especially in developing countries. Yet, only 40 developing countries have
quantifiable adaptation targets in their current NDCs;
49 countries include quantifiable targets in their
ssessment finds that the overall extent of adaptation
responses in human systems is low
and that there is limited evidence on the extent to
related responses in human systems are red
Thus there is an adaptation gap

across studies. Recent studies based on climate change under RCP8.5 report adaptation costs for
The emission gap ranges provided here is calculated as the difference between minimum and
